data.description: Research Interns put inquiry and theory into practice. Alongside fellow doctoral candidates and some of the world's best researchers, Research Interns learn, collaborate, and network for life. Research Interns not only advance their own careers, but they also contribute to exciting research and development strides. During the 12-week internship, Research Interns are paired with mentors and expected to collaborate with other Research Interns and researchers, present findings, and contribute to the vibrant life of the community. Research internships are available in all areas of research, and are offered year-round, though they typically begin in the summer. This summer we will explore critical opportunities for adapting and designing Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems to better serve the needs of a diversity of religious communities through model evaluations, product design, customer and employee research, responsible AI practices and more. Our Research Intern will have a range of potential projects to choose from within this domain and will be empowered to shape the work in the direction of their passion and external studies. The Research Internship will combine research and practice and involve collaboration with a range of internal and external stakeholders and aim to catalyze the development of a new research focus in this area. Accepted or currently enrolled in a PhD program in Computer Science, social sciences, or a related STEM. In addition to the qualifications below, you'll need to submit a minimum of two reference letters for this position as well as a cover letter and any relevant work or research samples. After you submit your application, a request for letters may be sent to your list of references on your behalf. Note that reference letters cannot be requested until after you have submitted your application, and furthermore, that they might not be automatically requested for all candidates. You may wish to alert your letter writers in advance, so they will be ready to submit your letter. Academic study or personal background related to religion, faith, theology or the social scientific study thereof. Experience in entrepreneurial, multistakeholder or multifunctional settings. Demonstrated interest in and dedication to issues of religious inclusion, liberty and participation in civic life. Experience translating abstract, ethical or philosophical principles into concrete, quantifiable metrics. Experience with multiple emerging technologies, such as, but not limited to, Generative AI, Agentic Systems. Demonstrated ability in prototyping with modern AI/ML and development platforms.
